clinicalDescription: Overview: (PRP) A group of skin conditions (rare) that cause constant inflammation and scaling of the skin. Cover the entire body or just parts of the body such as the elbows and knees, palms and soles. The palms and soles are usually involved and become diffusely thickened and yellowish (palmoplantar keratoderma). Juvenile and adult - cause and onset are unknown. Presentation:reddish-orange coloured scaling patches with well-defined borders, itchy, can spread over the entire body Assessment: Clinical appearance and skin biopsy, fail to respond to pssoriasis treatment Plan: Topical emollients, methotrexate, Acitretin, Isotretinoin, immunosuppresants, biologics, UV light therapy Prognosis: Inherited forms of PRP tend to persist throughout life whilst the sporadically acquired forms tend to resolve spontaneously eventually after one to three years
